commitResults.messageTitle: Level-10: Add GUI with FXML and colorful dialog boxes
Add assertions to document important assumptions
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added assertions to TaskList for index bounds checking and null validation
- Added assertions to Parser for input validation and command format checking
- Added assertions to Meeseeks for constructor and method parameter validation
- Added assertions to Storage for file path and TaskList validation
- Added assertions to AddCommand for parameter validation

These assertions help document critical assumptions and catch programming errors early.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve code quality across the codebase
commitResults.messageBody:
- Encapsulated Task class fields (made private) and added proper getters
- Replaced Boolean with boolean for consistency
- Added constants to eliminate magic numbers and strings
- Improved Parser class with constants for commands and separators
- Enhanced Storage class with try-with-resources for better resource management
- Added proper null checks and directory creation logic
- Added isEmpty() method to TaskList for better API
- Deprecated listTasks() method in favor of getTasksAsString() for separation of concerns
- Improved error messages and method documentation

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement Java streams features throughout the codebase
commitResults.messageBody:
- Refactored FindCommand to use streams for filtering tasks by keyword
- Enhanced TaskList with stream-based methods:
  - findTasksByKeyword() for efficient task searching
  - getCompletedTaskCount() and getPendingTaskCount() for statistics
  - Improved getTasksAsString() using IntStream and Collectors.joining()
- Updated Storage class to use streams for:
  - Loading tasks from file with map() and filter() operations
  - Saving tasks to file with stream-based content generation
- Added new StatsCommand that demonstrates advanced stream usage for task statistics
- Updated Parser to support the new stats command
- All stream operations use proper functional programming patterns with method references and lambda expressions

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch-A-Assertions: Add assertions to document important assumptions

commitResults.messageBody:
Combined assertions from branch-A-Assertions with constants from branch-A-CodeQuality
- Kept all assertion statements for input validation
- Used constants for command strings and separators
- Maintained both code quality improvements and assertion documentation

commitResults.messageTitle: Resolve merge conflicts and complete streams integration
commitResults.messageBody:
- Fixed Parser.java conflict by combining assertions with constants and adding stats command
- Fixed Storage.java conflict by combining improved directory handling with stream-based content generation
- Successfully integrated all three branches: assertions, code quality, and streams features

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement BCD-Extension: Support for managing recurring tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Features implemented:
- RecurrenceFrequency enum with DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY, YEARLY options
- RecurringTask class extending Task with recurrence functionality
- Automatic next due date calculation when task is marked as done
- Overdue detection and days until due calculation
- AddRecurringCommand for creating recurring tasks
- ListOverdueCommand for viewing overdue recurring tasks
- Updated Parser to handle 'recurring' and 'overdue' commands
- Full file format support for saving/loading recurring tasks
- Comprehensive test coverage for recurring task functionality

Command format: recurring <description> /every <frequency> /due <date>
Example: recurring Weekly team meeting /every weekly /due 15/1/2024 1400

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge BCD-Extension: Add support for managing recurring tasks
Using AI tools to help improve the quality of the current code, tweak an existing feature to make it more useful
Addition of commands on the add recurring command
Add comprehensive Git Flow Merge Documentation (GFMD)
commitResults.messageBody:
- Complete documentation of all feature branches and merge history
- Detailed description of assertions, code quality, streams, and recurring tasks features
- Merge conflict resolution documentation
- Final integrated features overview
- Quality assurance and testing information
- Usage examples and deployment information
- Repository status and conclusion

commitResults.messageTitle: Adding and publishing user guide for the Meeseeks Chatbox
updating the Ui image and the user guide, followed by minor adjustments for better user experience
Improve code quality and add comprehensive documentation
commitResults.messageBody:
- Add comprehensive JavaDoc comments to all public methods
- Standardize date format for recurring tasks to match deadline format
- Eliminate code duplication in ListOverdueCommand
- Add constants for magic numbers and hardcoded strings
- Improve parameter validation and error handling
- Extract complex logic into smaller, focused methods
- Enhance code readability and maintainability

Files modified:
- AddCommand.java: Added constants, comprehensive comments, extracted task creation logic
- FindCommand.java: Added validation, comprehensive comments, made keyword final
- ListOverdueCommand.java: Eliminated duplication, added helper methods, comprehensive comments
- RecurringTask.java: Added comprehensive comments for all getter methods
- TaskList.java: Added comprehensive comments for all public methods
- MainWindow.java: Added comprehensive comments for all methods
